result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samual Gerasimos Rodatos

records.addlTxt:
HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE HANRAHAN.  Defense request for adjournment granted. Parties contacted to reschedule. Parties agree upon next court date. All motions will be due at next court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
MOTION FOR EXTENSION OF TIME TO FILE MOTIONS.

Defendant Samual Gerasimos Rodatos in court.  Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court for Samual Gerasimos Rodatos.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review for possible motion. Court orders any suppression motion due on next court date (10-21-2022). Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defense requests a new scheduling date. Case set for new date off the record and given to counsel. Case remains calendared in Br 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM036945  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFF
07/29/2022

Defense contacted the Court regarding issue with bail and Defendant's 10-47.
Clerk contacted MCSO regarding same. 
Court confirmed that Cash Bail was previously set at $25,000.00 and TOT to JusticePoint Level 2.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Feiss.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Hanrahan , Br. 04.

Defendant Samual Gerasimos Rodatos in court by video with Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell who appears in person.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Detective J. Patterson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samual Gerasimos Rodatos in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Defendant Samual Gerasimos Rodatos in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in court for a Return on Warrant. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court that Defendant voluntarily surrendered to the Milwaukee County Sheriffs Department. Defense raised concerns regarding lack of medical treatment provided at CJF. Court ordered bail to be maintained at its current level. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch 46. Preliminary hearing scheduled July 21, 2022 at 1:30 pm. Hearing will be held in room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
No reply from the defendant or surtey.

Clerk contacted ADA Eric Bashirian and Attorney Robert Labell via email to schedule Return on Warrant hearing.
Return on Warrant hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022. Clerk provided information to MCSO.
Bench Warrant cleared by the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department on 07/13/2022.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($2,000.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Samual Gerasimos Rodatos not in court.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
The defendant having failed to appear with the conditions of his release, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

COURT INCREASED CASH BAIL TO $25,000.00. COURT STAYED ORDER TO JUNE 13, 2022. 
Defendant previously posted $2,000.00; therefore, Defendant must post an additional $23,000.00 for a GRAND TOTAL of $25,000.00.
All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

Defendant Samual Gerasimos Rodatos in Court with Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed State's Motion to Increase Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED State's Motion to Increase Bail. 

COURT STAYED ORDER TO JUNE 13, 2022. 
Court ordered Defendant to appear IN-PERSON for Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defense is NOT available June 8, 2022. Hearing rescheduled. 
NEW DATE: Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

State contacted the Court via email to schedule bail hearing. 
Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:25 am.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Information provided to Public Defender's Office and MCSO.
State Notice of Motion and Motion to Increase Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Court ordered no contact with ADC; KAG
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Samual Gerasimos Rodatos in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Samual Gerasimos Rodatos in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samual Gerasimos Rodatos appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
